screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][dfd_heading subtitle="" delimiter_settings="delimiter_style:solid|delimiter_width:0|delimiter_height:1" undefined="" title_font_options="tag:h2" subtitle_font_options="tag:div"]Don't fight the Fed works on the way up and down![/dfd_heading][vc_column_text]Since World War II, inflation (CPI) over 5% has preceded a recession every time. Oil prices doubling relative to the prior 2 year average ($54 in this case) has preceded a recession every time. 10 of the 13 prior recessions have been preceded by a tightening cycle by the Fed. 10 of the last 13 recessions have been preceded by the 10-year yield going below the 2-year yield. Any one of the above has a great track record in predicting a recession, but all of them have now occurred. This is not good for stock prices with valuations still extremely high.[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][vc_column_text]
You will learn...
[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][dfd_icon_list module_animation="transition.slideRightBigIn" list_fields="%5B%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22Fed%20actions%20matter.%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22The%20highest%20inflation%20in%20decades%20changes%20things.%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22Cash%20might%20not%20be%20a%20bad%20investment%20option%20today.%20%22%7D%5D" icon_border="border_style:none|border_color:%2334d288" main_style="style-1" icon_size="20" icon_color="#5e67bb" font_options="tag:h6|color:%2334d288"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][vc_column_text]Dan Niles is the founder and portfolio manager of the Satori Fund. The Satori Fund is an equity long/short fund which he has run since March of 2004. Prior to his career as a money manager, Dan was a sell-side semiconductor and computer hardware research analyst for ten years with Robertson, Stephens and then Lehman Brothers. Dan has received awards for stock picking from the Wall Street Journal in the categories of computer peripherals, computer hardware & PCs, and semiconductors. From 1990 to 1994, Dan was an investment banker at Robertson. Before starting his Wall Street career, Dan was an engineer with Digital Equipment Corp. Dan Received a Bachelor of Science in Systems Engineering from Boston University and a Master of Science in Electrical Engineering from Stanford University.[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer col_shadow_hover="box_shadow_enable:disable|shadow_horizontal:0|shadow_vertical:15|shadow_blur:50|shadow_spread:0|box_shadow_color:rgba(0%2C0%2C0%2C0.35)"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][dfd_heading subtitle="" delimiter_settings="delimiter_style:solid|delimiter_width:0|delimiter_height:1" undefined="" title_font_options="tag:h2" subtitle_font_options="tag:div"]The Inside Story on the "150 Portfolios Better Than Yours"[/dfd_heading][vc_column_text]In 2014 White Coat Investor wrote a column entitled, "150 Portfolios Better Than Yours." The article included a link to a list of almost every popular model portfolio including recommendations from Vanguard, Warren Buffett, Ray Dalio, Betterment, and a host of others. The list is now over 200. In this presentation Paul compares the range of returns from many of the portfolios, plus his own recommended portfolios. The 52-year returns of the all-equity combinations ranged from less than 10 to over 14 percent. The study reviews the risks and the returns of the portfolios. Paul explores 6 different risk measurements that would help investors select the best portfolio for their needs.[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][vc_column_text]
You will learn...
[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][dfd_icon_list module_animation="transition.slideRightBigIn" list_fields="%5B%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22How%20to%20select%20the%20best%20equity%20asset%20classes%20and%20ETFs%20to%20construct%20the%20best%20portfolio.%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22How%20to%20build%20a%20diversified%20portfolio%20of%20equity%20asset%20classes.%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22The%20best%20way%20to%20compare%20the%20long%20term%20returns%20of%20your%20portfolio.%22%7D%5D" icon_border="border_style:none|border_color:%2334d288" main_style="style-1" icon_size="20" icon_color="#5e67bb" font_options="tag:h6|color:%2334d288"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][vc_column_text]Paul Merriman is a nationally recognized expert on mutual funds, index investing and buy-and-hold investment strategies. He is the founder of Merriman Wealth Management, an investment advisory firm managing over $3 billion. Now retired, Merriman is dedicated to educating investors. He is the author of eight books, including “We’re Talking Millions!  12 Simple Ways to Supercharge Your Retirement,” and  “Financial Fitness Forever” (McGraw-Hill, 2011). He is a regular columnist on the retirement page of MarketWatch.com and produces a weekly podcast at paulmerriman.com. Merriman is also a contributing editor to the AAII Journal. In 2012, Merriman launched the Merriman Financial Education Foundation.  He received the  2021 James B. Cloonan Excellence in Investment Education Award.[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_separator color="blue"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/6"][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][/vc_column][vc_column width="2/3"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][vc_column_text]

WEBINAR ACCESS INFORMATION

PREPAY FOR THIS JUNE 18 WEBINAR MEETING ONLY
Please note that meetings will alternate between Webinar ONLY, and Skirball/Webinar Combo events. You may also prepay $10 for this Webinar ONLY meeting.
THIS PURCHASE SITE WILL CLOSE ON FRIDAY, JUNE 17 AT 6 PM.
 
CLICK HERE TO PREPAY FOR THIS WEBINAR MEETING ONLY
Note: (1) A Webinar registration link for this event will be emailed to payees on two dates: Friday, June 10, in the early evening, and Friday, June 17, after this purchase site closes at 6 pm; (2) Annual pass holders will receive a "name tag pass" at the Skirball Cultural Center at each of the remaining Skirball meetings next year, and will also receive an email with the registration link for the remaining Webinar meetings.  You will have the choice of viewing the Webinar on screen or attending the Skirball Center in person. Your annual pass gives you access to Skirball or the Webinar for each of the remaining combo Skirball/Webinar events.
[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1639077484345{background-color: #b5ffb6 !important;}"][/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/6"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: Financial Education meeting information that focuses on the broad overview of basic individual investing in today's market.
